div.p: Posted 3/26/2020
Dear Pittston Area Families,

My hope is this letter finds you and your family in good health. I wish to thank you for being patient and supportive these past two weeks as we have worked to implement learning activities for our 3,200 students. We recognize that this is a difficult time period for many of our families as we all navigate social distancing, business and school closures, and the associated challenges of COVID-19. I ask that we work together to help our students and your children return to normalcy in the midst of this unprecedented event.

In alignment with the Pennsylvania Department of Education’s guidance for continuity of education, Pittston Area Administration and Faculty have been working diligently to craft an educational program in an online format. Beginning Monday, March 30, teachers will be reaching out to students and parents to identify their ability to access online resources, whether that be a laptop, desktop, iPad/tablet, Chromebook, or smart phone. In order to maintain common routines that are familiar to our students and parents, Skyward Family/Student Access will continue to be your primary point of contact with your child’s teachers. Teachers will include all direction for resources and activities in their daily message. Faculty members will be available for 2-hour windows, Monday – Friday, to provide guidance and offer support.
Primary & Intermediate Center: 9:00 AM – 11:00 AM
High School: 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM
Middle School: 1:00 PM– 3:00 PM

The times are staggered for families that may have one device in the home and students at various buildings. Faculty can be emailed at any time outside of the 2-hour window, and the email will be answered within 24 hours, Monday – Friday. Guidance and health services will also be available via email.
Structure at Home

This format will cause a change for your household and no change comes without hurdles. It will be extremely important to establish structure and routine in the upcoming weeks. Some guidelines for attaining normalcy and routine for your child include:
· Identify a space, such as a dining room table, that could become the study space. It is beneficial to make this space different from a bedroom or other location with distractions.
· Develop a structured schedule for school work (e.g., 8:00 AM - 11:00 AM. and 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM). This structure will begin to form a routine.
· Eliminate other distractions, such as cell phones and television, from the environment.
· Ensure some “brain breaks” and exercise opportunities within the work times. The balance of mind and body will be especially important given the stress and anxiety of this global pandemic.
· Reinforce the importance of consistency in sleep patterns. We want to avoid “summer mode” when some students stay up very late and then “sleep until noon.”
· Reach out with questions. We want students and parents to ask for help or direction if they need it. All Pittston Area teachers and staff are available via email during the school day.

In closing, as our Patriot family begins this initiative on Monday, we are here to offer support, and ask for patience and flexibility during these challenging times. There will certainly be obstacles, which we will work together to overcome. Together we will make this work.
If you have any questions or concerns, please call your child’s respective building.
Yours in Education,
Kevin Booth
Superintendent of Schools

hr.h3: Important Announcement from LIU 18 & its Member Districts
hr.p: Luzerne and Wyoming Counties Students, Parents and Communities,

We want to thank you all for your patience, flexibility, and understanding during these uncertain times. We realize that you are anxious to get your children back to their typical routine and for everyone in our country to return to a sense of normalcy. We, as educators and school leaders, feel the same way. We especially want to encourage our Class of 2020 to remain positive and look to the future. COVID-19 should not take away from their accomplishments and future plans!

The Luzerne Intermediate Unit along with our member school districts: Crestwood, Dallas, Greater Nanticoke, Hanover Area, Hazleton Area, Lake-Lehman, Northwest Area, Pittston Area, Tunkhannock, Wilkes Barre Area, Wyoming Area, and Wyoming Valley West, as well as the West Side CTC and Wilkes Barre CTC, continue to work together as we receive guidance from our state and federal leaders. We have rapidly put food programs in place to support our communities and we are all working with the local food banks to help support our student's families. As always, our primary goal is the health, safety and welfare of all of your children and that has been the focus of last week as well as the beginning of our continuity of education plans.

This week, all districts are continuing their work on their Continuity of Education plans that you will begin to see rolled out in the coming days and weeks by individual school districts. As each of our school communities are unique, so will each individual district's continuity of education plan. We believe these plans to be the most appropriate and reasonable way to engage with our students at this time. Moreover, we willingly recognize that these plans may change as we receive further guidance on implementation from our state leadership.

As with any good education plan, we will need your support at home, as we look at alternative ways of continuing your sons and/or daughters education in these unprecedented times. We are committed to doing the very best we can for each one of our students.

We look forward to the day when we can welcome all of our students and teachers-back to our school buildings. And we know our students are anxious to get back to campus to continue their education as well as enjoy all the other positive aspects of coming to school like clubs, theater, sports, dances, lunch with friends and interactions with faculty, staff and administration.
Ensuring that we are a healthy community must remain our top priority until this threat has passed. Stay Healthy and please stay in contact with your child's school.

3/23/2020 - The Department of Education (PDE) announced today all schools in the commonwealth will remain closed through at least April 6 as a result of the COVID-19 response efforts. Under the new timeline, school buildings would reopen on April 7 for two days to allow school administrators, teachers and other staff time to prepare classrooms, set up cafeterias, schedule transportation and arrange other business operations. Students would return to school on April 9, unless extending the closure is needed in response to the situation with the virus at that time.

div.p: All extra-curricular activities will be suspended for the length of the closure. Please consult the website and Skyward for future updates.

hr.p: Dear Pittston Area Families and Community,

What a week! This has been a challenging time for all of us. Thank you for your cooperation, flexibility and support as we deal with this extraordinary challenge the Covid-19 virus has placed upon us.

The Department of Education (PDE) announced today all schools in the commonwealth will remain closed through at least April 6 as a result of the COVID-19 response efforts. The closure order could be extended beyond April 6 if necessary to save lives and stop the spread of COVID-19.

Under the new timeline, school buildings would reopen on April 7 for two days to allow school administrators, teachers and other staff time to prepare classrooms, set up cafeterias, schedule transportation and arrange other business operations. Students would return to school on April 9, unless extending the closure is needed in response to the situation with the virus at that time.

In the interim, the administration is continuing to plan for virtual learning opportunities for our students, in conjunction with guidance from local, state and federal sources. More information will follow shortly.
Lunches will continue to be distributed to any interested students from 11 am to 1 pm, Monday through Friday at the Intermediate Center.

Please continue to follow the guidance from our State and Federal Health Agencies and practice social distancing. I am looking forward to this being over, as I’m sure all of you are and getting our lives back to normal. Please take care of yourselves and your families and stay safe.

I would like to update and clarify an area of confusion. Students are not required to complete any assignments at this time, other than what was handed out on Friday. Teachers have been directed to refrain from posting assignments to their websites for the time being. The district will continue to attain guidance from the Department of Education and will provide updates when they are available. In the interim, attached is information on how students can access their learning materials at home. All of our students (K-12) access the Clever portal daily to access material at school. The portal provides access to age-appropriate apps based on the student’s grade and course enrollments. These apps and websites are meant to be resources for students to access while school is closed to help with the continuity of education, but in no way are they expected to supplant direct instruction.
The resources include apps that our district purchases such as:
· Textbook resources (Coach Digital, McGraw-Hill, Harcourt, Pearson, ThinkCentral, Edhesive, EMC Passport)
· Digital Safety (Kiddle, KidRex, Common Sense Education, Be Internet Awesome)
· College Readiness (FAFSA, FastWeb, Scholarships.com, The Common App, Coalition App, College Greenlight, ScholarMatch)

I hope this message finds you safe and healthy. This has been unprecedented time in all of our lives and it continues to change minute to minute. At this point, the Pittston Area School District will be closed for the next two weeks by order of Governor Wolf. During this closure, all buildings are being cleaned and sanitized thoroughly. In the meantime, breakfast and lunch will be distributed at all buildings from 11 am to 1 pm, Monday through Friday, beginning March 17. Instructions for disbursement and the menu are posted on the website. Currently, students are responsible to complete work they were given on Friday before they left. Teachers are not required to place new assignments on their pages or the website at this time. Continue to check the website for updates. I encourage all students to take this time off and stay healthy, while continuing to stay engaged with you studies.
